physical_appearance: This is a drawn diagram of an engine fuel system. There are six cylinders drawn in the center of the paper, with arrows along a saft at the bottom. The bottom of the diagram shows a top view of an adjusting collar, with a circular diagram in the center marking out the angles. The edges of the document is slightly folded and torn, especially on the bottom-right corner.
sgcool_label_text: Loose papers from the James Steele, P.O.W archive that include a symbolic drawing, Japanese banana money, map of camp, administrative papers from Changi prison pre-dating internment, list of soldiers of a regiment as well as James Steeleâ€™s warrant to  join the army. These papers are part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Miscellaneous scraps of paper from P.O.W James Steele Archives (30 pieces) P.O.W. James Steele Archives: Drawn diagram of engine fuel
subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war diagrams gas engines
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Drawing Graphs Internal combustion engines
